turns.content: invent a word for looking across an entire food buffet before choosing what to put on your plate
can you make it a single word, like a portmanteau

Sure, here are a few portmanteau options:

1. Buffetize - a combination of "buffet" and "visualize", suggesting the act of visually surveying a buffet before making selections.
2. Spreadscope - a combination of "spread" and "periscope", implying a sweeping visual survey of a food spread.
3. Platemap - a combination of "plate" and "map", suggesting a mental mapping of the buffet layout before choosing items for one's plate.
4. Culinary reconnaissance - This one is not a portmanteau, but it does have a nice ring to it and captures the idea of visually scouting out a buffet before making selections.
How about buffetnoiter a portmanteau of buffet and reconnoiter.
I like that one! "Buffetnoiter" is a clever portmanteau that effectively captures the idea of reconnoitering a buffet spread before selecting food items. Great suggestion!
can you use it in a sentence?

Sure, here's an example sentence using "buffetnoiter":

Before loading up his plate, John took a moment to buffetnoiter the entire spread, carefully assessing each dish before deciding on his favorites.
